did.abstract: Civil War letters to Caroline Gardner from friends and cousins. Primary correspondents are Thomas J. Gardner, 2nd Regiment, North Carolina Cavalry, and Marshall Moffitt. Topics include camp life, military skirmishes, prisoners from First Manassas arriving in Tarboro, a train accident, and disappointment over a speech by Governor Vance, 1864. Also included are papers of the Kivett family of Missouri, who appear to have been friends of Caroline Gardner. These containing descriptions of Texas County, Mo., as well as some Civil War correspondence from Jacob Kivett.
